channel.title: Open Source Software on Nathaniel Saul | Around About
channel.description: Recent content in Open Source Software on Nathaniel Saul | Around About

item.title: Kepler Mapper
item.description: I actively maintain Kepler Mapper, a popular Python library for creating and visualizing Mappers. We provide a scikit-learn style API that is intuitive and approachable for data scientists and machine learning researchers. Check out the documentation.

item.title: Persim
item.description: I developed Persim, a library for computing persistence images of persistence diagrams. To learn more, check out the documentation page or see the source on github.

item.title: Ripser.py
item.description: Along with Christopher Tralie, I help maintain the Python wrapper for Ripser, a blazingly fast c++ project originally developed by Ulrich Bauer. My contribution have been user focused, spending most of my time on building an intuitive Python interface, visualization functionality, deployment and packaging, and automated testing and continuous integration.

item.title: TaDAsets
item.description: TaDAsets is a project intended to provide easy to use data sets for demonstrating and exploring analytics techniques. The goal is to provide constructors for many common topological objects. Check out the documentation or the source code on github
